content.question:
Because cheetahs, Acinonyx jubatus, experienced a bottleneck event about ten thousand years ago, living cheetahs exhibit very little genetic variation compared to other living species of large cats.
Which of the following principles best justifies a claim that cheetahs, compared to other large cats, have a relatively low resilience to environmental perturbations?

choices.label: A captive population of cheetahs kept in a confined area will have a greater risk of contracting and passing on a virus.
When a population is reduced, new niches become available in the environment, which can trigger adaptive radiation.
Populations with little genetic diversity are less likely to contain individuals that can withstand different selective pressures.
Populations with low genetic diversity are more likely to contain individuals that can withstand different selective pressures.

content.answer: Populations with little genetic diversity are less likely to contain individuals that can withstand different selective pressures.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
